examples.sentence: Location of existence - where something exists

sections.heading: Core Functions
sections.content:
に is one of the most versatile particles with 5 main uses:

Destination - where you're going Location of existence - where something exists Time - when something happens Indirect object - to/for whom Purpose - what for

sections.heading: 1. Destination (Movement)
sections.content:
With verbs of movement - where you're going to :

学校に行く - "go to school" 日本に来る - "come to Japan" 家に帰る - "return home" 東京に着く - "arrive in Tokyo"

Common verbs: 行く, 来る, 帰る, 入る, 乗る

sections.heading: 2. Location of Existence
sections.content:
With ある/いる - where something is :

机の上に本があります "There's a book on the desk" 部屋に猫がいます "There's a cat in the room" 東京に住んでいます "I live in Tokyo"

Must use に with ある/いる for location.

sections.heading: 3. Specific Time
sections.content:
When something happens:

三時に会いましょう - "Let's meet at 3 o'clock" 月曜日に行きます - "I'll go on Monday" 2020年に生まれました - "I was born in 2020"

No に with relative time:

今日行く ✓ (not 今日に) 明日来る ✓ (not 明日に)

sections.heading: 4. Indirect Object
sections.content:
To/for whom - the receiver:

友達に本をあげる "give a book to a friend" 先生に質問する "ask the teacher a question" 母に電話する "call (to) mother"

Pattern: [Person]に [Thing]を Verb

sections.heading: 5. Purpose
sections.content:
What you're going for (with movement verbs):

買い物に行く "go shopping" 映画を見に行く "go to see a movie" 勉強しに来た "came to study"

Pattern: [Verb stem]に行く/来る

sections.heading: に vs で
sections.content:
Key difference:

に = static location (exist/be) で = action location (do something) 図書館にいる - "be at library" (existence) 図書館で勉強する - "study at library" (action)

See: に vs で Explained

sections.heading: に vs へ
sections.content:
Both mark destination, へ more abstract:

東京に行く ✓ - "go to Tokyo" 東京へ行く ✓ - "go toward Tokyo"

See: へ vs に Direction

children.heading: Existence
children.content: [Place]に [Thing]が ある/いる 部屋に机がある - "there's a desk in the room"

children.heading: Movement
children.content: [Place]に 行く/来る/帰る 学校に行く - "go to school"

children.heading: Indirect Object
children.content: [Person]に [Thing]を Verb 友達に手紙を書く - "write a letter to friend"

children.heading: Purpose
children.content: [Verb stem]に 行く/来る 食べに行く - "go to eat"

children.heading: Use に:
children.content: 月曜日に - on Monday 3時に - at 3 o'clock 2020年に - in 2020 誕生日に - on birthday

children.heading: Don't use に:
children.content: 今日 - today 明日 - tomorrow 毎日 - every day 去年 - last year

children.heading: Movement
children.content: 行く, 来る, 帰る, 入る, 着く, 乗る, 降りる

children.heading: Existence
children.content: ある, いる, 住む

children.heading: Attachment
children.content: つける - attach to 入れる - put into

children.heading: Communication
children.content: 言う - say to 話す - speak to 聞く - ask/hear from

sections.heading: Multiple Uses in One Sentence
sections.content: 友達に会いに東京に行きます "I'll go to Tokyo to meet a friend" (に for indirect object + に for purpose + に for destination)

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Destination (where going) ✓ Location of existence (where is) ✓ Specific time points ✓ Indirect object (to/for whom) ✓ Purpose (what for) ✓ Not used with relative time words

Related:
